intro: Melandrium dioicum subsp. divaricatum, commonly known as the divided catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and woodland edges. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in temperate climates and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
